results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 1. Season 1. Eps 01-05
results.creator_credit: Stephen Johnson, Pino Amenta, Ray Boseley, Esben Storm, Patricia Edgar, Disney Channel Australia and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 1: Mike, Pi, Bec, Marcello and Ram all decipher a coded message on the net which leads them to Catalyst software where they are offered the job of their dreams - testing video games after school. Episode 2: While testing a video game the kids encounter Virgil, an artificial intelligence that lives inside the Internet, and uncover his origins. Episode 3: When Alex, the head of Catalyst, loses her necklace, the gang comes under suspicion. At the same time Marcello’s little sister is lost on the streets, giving the friends two cases to solve. Episode 4: Master inventor and the youngest of the group Ram, gets more than he bargained for when he sells one of his adventures to a strange girl. Episode 5: A computer virus invades Catalyst threatening the company’s computer systems. The team is tense after Mike fails to defend Bec when his friends make racist comments to her. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: Risks and wrongs (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 15 of Series “Teenagers’ guide to the galaxy”.
Part of a series developed for young people aged 9-16 which deals with issues of communication skills, interpersonal skills, life skills and problem solving. “Risks and wrongs” explores risk-taking, or illegal activities such as stealing or vandalism, and peer pressure among teenagers. Includes hints and advice from teenagers, police and other adults on issues such as being assertive; saying ‘no’; image amongst peers; friends - real or otherwise; actions and consequences; responsibility. Features Colette Mann as Fay.

results.title: Making a good impression (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Teenagers’ guide to the galaxy”.
Part of a series developed for young people aged 9-16 which deals with issues of communication skills, interpersonal skills, life skills and problem solving. “Making a good impression” discusses what is required to impress others, particularly when applying for a job. Includes hints and advice by teenagers and adults on appearance; manners and etiquette; respect for yourself and others; initiative; preparation; confidence. Features Colette Mann as Fay.

results.title: Assertive with adults (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Teenagers’ guide to the galaxy”.
Part of a series developed for young people aged 9-16 which deals with issues of communication skills, interpersonal skills, life skills and problem solving. “Assertive with adults” focuses on ways of negotiating with parents, teachers and other adults to achieve a satisfactory, or win-win, outcome. Includes personal hints and advice from adults and teenagers such as choosing the right time; listen to what the adult is saying; expressing clearly your wants and needs; negotiating and being prepared to compromise. Features Colette Mann as Fay.

results.title: Reach for the stars (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Teenagers’ guide to the galaxy”.
Part of a series developed for young people aged 9-16 which deals with issues of communication skills, interpersonal skills, life skills and problem solving. “Reach for the stars” is all about your potential, your future and what you will be doing for the rest of your life. It discusses how you can help achieve that path to success or make your dreams come true and includes hints and worldly advice from teenagers and adults about decision-making; career choices; motivation; setting goals; initiative; self belief and potential. Features Colette Mann as Fay.

results.title: Kingdom of David: the saga of the Israelites [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Mitch Wilson, Carl Byker and Oregon Public Broadcasting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Empires”.
Kingdom of David: the saga of the Israelites is the story of one of the most profoundly influential religions, Judaism. This illuminating work features historical re-enactments, as well as interviews with contemporary scholars, to recall the ancient worlds depicted in the Bible. Episode 1. “By the rivers of Babylon”: In 586 BC, the Israelites were exiled in Babylon and seemed destined to disappear; but they fought back by writing a book using Judean stories to explain the present disastrous situations - the Bible. Episode 2. “The Book and the sword”: In 458 BC a scribe named Ezra arrived in Jerusalem from Babylon; gathering the mostly illiterate Judeans together he read the Bible to them. In the following years study of the Bible became an essential part of Jewish life. Episode 3. “The End of days”: When the Roman General Pompeii led his legions into the land of Judea in 63 BC it was the beginning of a clash of cultures that grew into one of the most brutal conflicts in history. Terrorism, political assassination, starvation and crucifixion dominated the landscape, ending with the Roman sack of Jerusalem and the destruction of the Temple in 70 AD. From the aftermath, two new religions rose: rabbinical Judaism and Christianity. Episode 4. “The Gifts of the Jews”: In 132 AD Jewish zealots rebelled against Rome’s legions, forcing them to withdraw from the region. The Romans returned with a vast army, slaughtered nearly 600,000 Jews, changed the name of the region from Judea to Palestine and banned all Jews from Jerusalem. Many Jews fled to distant lands only to face another challenge - a breakaway form of Judaism called Christianity.
results.title_for_label: Kingdom of David: the saga of the Israelites [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mitch Wilson, Carl Byker and Oregon Public Broadcasting

results.title: Queen Victoria's empire
results.creator_credit: Paul Burgess, Paul Bryers, Brook Lapping, Devillier Donegan Enterprises and Public Broadcasting Service (U.S.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Empires”.
At the time of Queen Victoria’s birth in 1819 England was an agrarian society; within a few short decades this nation would be transformed into an industrial superpower, with an empire spanning the globes. This captivating four part series covers the transition with historical re-enactments, stills and interviews with historians, providing a portrait of Queen Victoria and British imperialism. Episode 1. “Engines of change”: Explores the changes brought to Britain by the industrial revolution, urban migration, overcrowding, extremes in poverty and pollution of the 1840s and Prince Albert’s role. Episode 2. “Passage to India”: In the 1850s, as steamships take British goods around the globe, tensions rise in India with a clash of Victorian values and Indian culture, resulting in the Great Mutiny and Cawnpore massacre of 1857; also covers the Crimean War and the death of Prince Albert. Episode 3. “The Moral Crusade”: By 1861 Britain is the wealthiest and most powerful nation on earth; David Livingstone’s explorations of the African interior fascinate the British public; Disraeli and Gladstone battle for control of the government; colonisation of Africa begins. Episode 4. “The scramble for Africa”: The Suez Canal is threatened by a holy war in the Sudan; Cecil Rhodes prospects diamond deposits in South Africa and asserts regional control; the Boer War leads to devastating British losses; Queen Victoria’s death marks the end of an era.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Burgess, Paul Bryers, Brook Lapping, Devillier Donegan Enterprises and Public Broadcasting Service (U.S.)

results.title: Peter & Paul and the Christian revolution
results.creator_credit: Margaret Koval, Patricia Aste and Koval Films LLC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Empires”.
Traces the life of early Christians Peter and Paul, who faced powerful obstacles - including the mighty Roman Empire, political persecution and crippling personal disagreements - in their attempts to spread the word of Jesus. Episode 1. “The Rock and the river” - With the Messiah dead and their cause deemed subversive, the followers of Jesus face a bleak future, until their hope is re-invigorated by a vision of the risen Jesus. A former persecutor of Christians, Peter soon becomes an indomitable figure, uniting the group into a tight community of ardent believers. Paul, educated, passionate, determined and dogmatic, uses his formidable talents to spread his new beliefs around the Roman Empire. Episode 2. “The Empire and the Kingdom” - Led by missionaries, Christian ideas continue to spread among Jews and non-Jews throughout the Empire; hostile locals, imperial forces and conflicting ideas threaten the future of the movement. Paul splits with his former allies, establishing churches in his image; in 70 AD, after decades of tensions, a four-year war erupts that destroys much of Jerusalem, but the communities established by Paul survive and grow. Fascinating work features the words of Paul and other ancient writers, historical re-enactments and interviews with contemporary scholars.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Margaret Koval, Patricia Aste and Koval Films LLC
